config.question: Why did FDR prefer to deal with the pro-German Vichy government of France rather than the government of Free France under Charles de Gaulle?

choices.content: It controlled the French fleet and most of France’s overseas territories.
It was more sympathetic to Allied ideology than de Gaulle’s government.
France had refused to pay long-standing debts to the United States.
The threat posed by the Germans was greater than the threat of the French.

answer_3.response: Roosevelt preferred to deal with the pro-German regime at Vichy in France because it controlled the French fleet and most of France’s overseas territories.
